results:
Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about the first edition publication details of Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World" published by Chatto & Windus in 1932:

## Publication Details

Brave New World is a dystopian novel by English author Aldous Huxley, written in 1931, and published in 1932. The first edition was published by Chatto & Windus in London in 1932.

## Physical Description

The first edition was published in London in 1932 by Chatto & Windus in blue cloth with the top edge stained blue and an iconic blue and white illustrated jacket. More specific details include:

- Octavo format, 306 pages
- Bound in original blue cloth with gilt lettering on the spine
- Pages not guillotined at bottom edge, top edge stained blue
- Original dust jacket price was 7s. 6d.net

## Limited Edition

There was also a special limited edition: Signed, limited deluxe first edition, no.135 of 324 copies produced, with publisher's lightly bevelled yellow buckram with blue morocco title label to spine, gilt, untrimmed paper, t.e.g.

## Publication Significance

In 1998 and 1999, the Modern Library ranked Brave New World at number 5 on its list of the 100 Best Novels in English of the 20th century. The book has become one of the defining novels of the twentieth century, a dystopian vision which distils the fears arising from scientific advance.

The first edition is highly sought after by collectors, with the first edition published by Chatto & Windus increasingly difficult to find in collectible condition.
